intro: Henckelia membranacea, commonly known as the membranous henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, papery leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native range.
